title: Set Up Equation For the Given Condition
text: Let $$x=actual$$ height of the cat. We can translate the given conditions into a proportion actual $$\frac{height}{height}$$ of $$shadow=actual$$ $$\frac{height}{height}$$ of shadow which gives $$\frac{2}{3}=\frac{x}{1}$$.

title: Solve Equation
text: Solve for $$\frac{2}{3}=\frac{x}{1}$$. What is $$x$$? We can simplify the equation into $$x=\frac{2}{3}$$ which gives the final answer. Therefore, the cat is $$\frac{2}{3}$$ feet tall.
